name: UnionAssuranceLevelAndAssuranceLevel
title: Union of AuditEvent.agent Assurance Level And AuditEvent.agent Assurance Level

element.definition:
The assuranceLevel element carries various types of Assurance level. May be an Identity Assurance (IAL), an Authentication Assurance Level (AAL), a Federation Assurance Level (FAL), or other. 

In SAML this is [defined to be carried] in the `saml:AuthnContextClassRef`, but may be carried elsewhere based on the use-case and profiling of SAML.

The Vocabulary is not defined here. Some sources of vocabulary:
- HL7 v3 [Security Trust Assurance ValueSet]. These include ISO-7498-2, NIST 800-63-1, and NIST-800-63-2.
- [idmanagement.gov] published on login.gov
  - this is defined to be carried in the saml:AuthnContextClassRef
- OASIS [Authentication Context for SAML]
- An example of a customized and purpose defined small set of codes can be found in the HL7 [SMART Health Cards] defines a [valueset]

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

element.definition: Unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references). This may be any string value that does not contain spaces.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

element.short: identifies the meaning of the extension
element.definition: Source of the definition for the extension code - a logical name or a URL.
element.comment: The definition may point directly to a computable or human-readable definition of the extensibility codes, or it may be a logical URI as declared in some other specification. The definition SHALL be a URI for the Structure Definition defining the extension.

element.definition: Value of extension - must be one of a constrained set of the data types (see [Extensibility] for a list).

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
